author: Danny Zepeda
title: iPhone 8 won’t feature curved OLED display after all
text:
So it looks like the iPhone 8 won’t be as cool as we thought it might be.
Earlier reports of iPhone 8 stated it would feature a new OLED curved display to match the Samsung’s curved displays, but it appears that won’t happen. According to a number of analysts , Apple has scrapped plans to add a curved display to its next flagship phone. Among those analysts is KGI Securities’ Ming Chi-Kuo , who has a strong track record of predicting Apple products.
The curved display is one of the hottest rumors circulating about the iPhone 8.
The news is a bit disappointing even though it was always a pie in the sky type of rumor. The iPhone 8 is still rumored to include a 5.8-inch OLED flat display with reduced front bezels that will eliminate the home button. If Apple would have included a curved display, it would have been one of the most surprising additions. The new iPhone is still expected to be a big departure from the iPhone 7’s design, which has been the same since the iPhone 6 debuted in 2014. That’s a long time time for an upgrade.
The i Phone 8 still feels like the more exciting phone compared to the Galaxy S8, even without the curved display. We’ll keep you posted on any new rumors or leaks pertaining to the iPhone 8.
